intro: Piper tenuilimbum var. villosum, commonly known as the hairy soursop, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the common soursop but is often smaller and has a more pronounced hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional medicinal uses in local cultures.
